you-sent: Here is the information you have sent us

caseworker.heading: BRP reported as lost or stolen

lost-stolen.header: Thank you for reporting that your biometric residence permit (BRP) has been lost or stolen. We will now cancel your BRP and it can’t be reactivated.
lost-stolen.subheading: If you find your BRP, you must return it to the address below as soon as possible after you return to the UK
lost-stolen.paragraph-one: To return to the UK you must apply for a Replacement BRP visa. More information can be found on the GOV.UK website.
lost-stolen.paragraph-two: You should not make arrangements to travel back to the UK until you receive your replacement BRP visa.
lost-stolen.paragraph-three: This office can’t help you with the Replacement BRP Visa application process and won’t respond to enquiries.
lost-stolen.paragraph-four: Don’t reply to this email for help regarding your replacement BRP visa. Instead, you should direct enquiries to your local Visa Application Centre.
lost-stolen.paragraph-eea: If you’re using your EEA treaty rights to stay in the UK as a dependent of an EEA National and have lost your residence card outside of the UK, you must ask your local Visa Application Centre.
lost-stolen.header-three: When you return to the UK
lost-stolen.paragraph-six: When you return to the UK, you must apply for a replacement BRP. You can’t apply for a replacement while you are outside of the UK. You must make your application within 3 months of returning to the UK, otherwise you may:

paragraph-six-bullets.one: receive a fine of up to £1,000
paragraph-six-bullets.two: have your permission to stay in UK taken away

lost-stolen.paragraph-eight: Applications for a replacement BRPs take the following times to consider:

paragraph-eight-bullets.one: up to eight weeks of receipt if you hold limited leave to enter or remain
paragraph-eight-bullets.two: up to six months of receipt if you hold indefinite leave to enter or remain

lost-stolen.paragraph-nine: If you require a replacement BRP urgently, you can book an appointment to apply in person at a Premium Service Centre.
lost-stolen.paragraph-eea-deps-one: If you’re using your EEA treaty rights to stay in the UK as a dependent of an EEA National, you can choose whether or not to replace your residence card. You will not receive a penalty if you don’t replace it.
lost-stolen.paragraph-eea-deps-two: If you apply for a replacement EEA treaty rights residence card and later have an urgent need to travel, you should phone the European Enquiries contact centre on 0300 123 2253.
lost-stolen.paragraph-ten: You do not need a BRP to leave the UK, but you will need a BRP or a Replacement BRP visa to return.
lost-stolen.paragraph-eleven: Once you have returned to the UK, if you submit a replacement BRP application and then need to travel urgently, you must either:

paragraph-eleven-bullets.one: withdraw the application and make a new one at a Premium Service Centre
paragraph-eleven-bullets.two: leave the UK and apply for a Replacement BRP Visa at a Visa Application Centre while you are overseas

lost-stolen.paragraph-twelve: If you apply for a replacement EEA treaty rights residence card and later have an urgent need to travel, you can discuss your options with the European Enquiries contact centre on 0300 123 2253.
lost-stolen.fake-email: If you receive an email about UK Visas and Immigration and are unsure of its authenticity, do not reply to it or click on any of the links.

lost-stolen-uk.paragraph-one: You must apply for a replacement BRP within 3 months. If you don’t you may:
lost-stolen-uk.eea-paragraph-one: If you’re exercising EEA treaty rights in the UK, you can choose whether or not to replace your residence card. You will not receive a penalty if you don’t replace it.
lost-stolen-uk.eea-paragraph-two: If you apply for a replacement EEA treaty rights residence card and later have an urgent need to travel, you can discuss your options with the European Enquiries contact centre on 0300 123 2253.

you-sent: Here is the information you have sent us
